intro: Astrantia macrolema, commonly known as the giant aster, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern North America. It features showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. The plant has a basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and tall, branching stems that support its flower heads. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and wetlands. The plant is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
